closeness.low: Avoidant — distances from finances; avoids checking balances or engaging with details.
closeness.mid: Balanced— can face money calmly and realistically without emotional swings.
closeness.high: Anxious — monitors constantly; heightened vigilance or worry around spending and savings.
closeness.signature: Measures emotional comfort and engagement with financial reality.

control.low: Helpless — feels acted upon by circumstances; lacks perceived control over money.
control.mid: Adaptive — takes deliberate action while allowing flexibility when needed.
control.high: Vigilant — over-monitors, tightly controls finances, struggles to relax rules even when appropriate.
control.signature: Gauges how one balances initiative and adaptability in money management.

selfWorth.low: Insecure — sees finances as proof of inadequacy; shame or comparison-driven.
selfWorth.mid: Grounded — values self-worth beyond status; open to growth without defensiveness.
selfWorth.high: Prideful — links achievement to superiority; resistant to vulnerability or feedback.
selfWorth.signature: Reflects whether money reinforces or expresses a healthy sense of self.

boundary.low: Compliant — gives or spends to maintain harmony; difficulty asserting limits.
boundary.mid: Clear — gives and receives with clarity; generosity and protection coexist.
boundary.high: Guarded — highly protective of resources; cautious or resistant to shared spending.
boundary.signature: Captures how one balances generosity, reciprocity, and personal security.

growth.low: Settled — avoids financial experimentation; prefers comfort over improvement.
growth.mid: Reflective — learns through reflection and small, steady adjustments.
growth.high: Driven — seeks constant optimization; restless pursuit of “better” without pause.
growth.signature: Indicates openness to learning and capacity for sustained improvement.
